channel.title: Comments on: Human Readable Dates in XPages

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Good stuff Dec, that's probably an easier way of using the code.</p>
item.content:encoded: Good stuff Dec, that’s probably an easier way of using the code.

item.title: By: Declan Lynch
item.dc:creator: Declan Lynch
item.description: <p>Actually very easy... </p><p>Removed the function prototyping so that is it just a plain script and set the dt_then as follows :</p><p>dt_then = session.createDateTime(value);</p><p>'value' is what is passed into the converter. I set the include Seconds as true directly in the script. and bingo, works great.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Actually very easy…

Removed the function prototyping so that is it just a plain script and set the dt_then as follows :

dt_then = session.createDateTime(value);

‘value’ is what is passed into the converter. I set the include Seconds as true directly in the script. and bingo, works great.

item.title: By: Declan Lynch
item.dc:creator: Declan Lynch
item.description: <p>I wonder how easy it would be to turn this into a 'converter' for field values rather then a function to call.</p>
item.content:encoded: I wonder how easy it would be to turn this into a ‘converter’ for field values rather then a function to call.

item.title: By: Jake Howlett
item.dc:creator: Jake Howlett
item.description: <p>Nice work Matt. Thanks for the nod. <br/>This all makes me realise how backwards I am right now. Must start using XPages....</p>
item.content:encoded:
Nice work Matt. Thanks for the nod.
This all makes me realise how backwards I am right now. Must start using XPages….
